line.text: So are you to my thoughts as food to life
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Or as sweet-seasoned showers are to the ground
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: And for the peace of you I hold such strife
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: As twixt a miser and his wealth is found
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Now proud as an enjoyer and anon
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Doubting the filching age will steal his treasure
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Now counting best to be with you alone
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Then bettered that the world may see my pleasure
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Sometime all full with feasting on your sight
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: And by and by clean starved for a look
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*
s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Save what is had or must from you be took
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Thus do I pine and surfeit day by day
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Or gluttoning on all or all away
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*
